title: Happy Anniversary, Mom and Dad! 70+ Wishes for Parents

steps.title: Brighten your parents’ day with one of these short and sweet messages.
steps.content: Brighten your parents’ day with one of these short and sweet messages. These brief but sincere messages are great options if you’re sending your parents a quick text before meeting up with them in-person later. They also make great captions if you’re posting a picture in honor of your parents’ anniversary on social media! “Happy anniversary, Mom and Dad! Wishing you all the love and happiness in the world on your special day.” “Wishing you both a very happy anniversary. Your love story is truly one for the ages!” “Mom and Dad, thank you for showing me what true love looks like. Happy anniversary!” “Today, we celebrate a truly beautiful love story. Happy anniversary, Mom and Dad!” “Happy anniversary to my favorite couple in the world. I love you so much, Mom and Dad!” “Mom and Dad, your marriage is a beautiful example of what love should be. Happy anniversary!” “Happy anniversary to the people who taught me everything I know about love, my incredible parents.” “Mom and Dad, your devotion to each other is an inspiration. Thank you for showing me what real love looks like.” “Wishing a very happy wedding anniversary to my favorite couple in the world. Love you, Mom and Dad!”

steps.title: Celebrate your parents’ love with these thoughtful anniversary wishes.
steps.content: Celebrate your parents’ love with these thoughtful anniversary wishes. If you want to write a longer, more sentimental note to your parents on their special day, try using these messages as inspiration. Your parents will be thankful that you took the time to write something so heartfelt and meaningful! “Happy anniversary, Mom and Dad! Your relationship is an incredible example of what true love looks like, and I’m so thankful that I’ve gotten to witness it my whole life. I love you both so much." “Happy anniversary to my amazing parents! Congratulations on another year of memories, triumphs, laughter, and most of all, love. I’m so inspired by your devotion to each other, and I feel so lucky to be your child.” “Wishing a very happy anniversary to the best parents in the world. Throughout my life, you’ve shown me that love isn’t just a feeling—it’s an action and a choice you make every single day. Thank you for setting such an incredible example!” “Congratulations on another year of marriage, Mom and Dad! Every single day, I’m in awe of your commitment, patience, and deep love for one another. I love you both with my whole heart.” “On your special day, I want to let the both of you know how much I love and appreciate you. Thank you for supporting me through thick and thin, and for setting such an incredible example of what real love looks like with your relationship. Happy anniversary!”

steps.title: The bond between a daughter and her parents is truly special.
steps.content: The bond between a daughter and her parents is truly special. If your parents’ anniversary is coming up, let them know how much you appreciate them and how much you admire their commitment to each other with one of these loving and thoughtful messages. “Mom and Dad, congratulations on another year of marriage! Your love and commitment to each other is inspiring, and I’m so lucky to be your daughter.” “Happy anniversary to the best parents a girl could ever ask for! Thank you for showing me the true meaning of love and devotion.” “Wishing the happiest of anniversaries to my parents, the two people who showed me what real love looks like. I’m so proud to be your daughter!” “Happy anniversary to the best parents in the world! I’m not sure what I did to be blessed with the kindest, funniest, and most loving parents out there, but I’m grateful for it everyday. Love, your daughter.” “Mom and Dad, you’ve set the example for me my whole life, and I can safely say that your love has shaped me into the woman I am today. Thank you for everything you do, and happy anniversary!”

steps.title: Let your parents know how much they mean to you on their special day.
steps.content: Let your parents know how much they mean to you on their special day. Your thoughtful and sincere message will bring a smile to their faces and make their anniversary even more special. Here are some ideas to inspire you: “Happy anniversary, Mom and Dad! As your son, I’ve gotten to witness your relationship up close, and it’s taught me so much about true love and commitment. Thank you for setting such an incredible example!” “Wishing a happy anniversary to the people who taught me everything I know. I feel so lucky to be your son, and I can’t wait to celebrate this special occasion tonight.” “Mom and Dad, your devotion to each other and to our family inspire me every day. Thank you for being the best parents I could ever ask for! Love, your son.” “Happy anniversary to my favorite couple out there—my parents! Congratulations on another year filled with love and laughter. I’m so proud to be your son.” “To the most wonderful parents I could have asked for, happy anniversary! Your relationship convinces me that true love is real, and that I’ll find it one day. I hope you have the best anniversary ever.”

steps.title: Send your parents a loving message to celebrate this huge milestone.
steps.content: Send your parents a loving message to celebrate this huge milestone . According to research on marital duration conducted in 2018, only 41% of married couples made it to their 25th wedding anniversary. [1] X Research source If your parents have made it to this major milestone, send them a message to congratulate them on their lasting love! “Congratulations on 25 years of marriage, Mom and Dad. Your devotion to each other is truly inspiring, and I’m so lucky to have parents as amazing as you!” “Wishing a very happy 25th wedding anniversary to my wonderful parents! This is such an incredible milestone, and I’m so excited to celebrate it with you.” “Happy anniversary, Mom and Dad! I’m so thankful you said 'I do' to each other 25 years ago and built this amazing life for our family.” “Wow, 25 years! An accomplishment like that deserves some serious celebration. Congratulations on this major milestone, Mom and Dad!” “Happy anniversary to my favorite couple in the world. Over the past 25 years, you two have shown each other endless patience, commitment, support, and love, and I feel so lucky to witness your beautiful love story.”

steps.title: 50 years of marriage is definitely something to be proud of!
steps.content: 50 years of marriage is definitely something to be proud of! Based on the same 2018 research, only 8% of married couples made it to their 50th wedding anniversary. [2] X Research source With this in mind, it's pretty clear that 50 years of marriage is a rare and impressive achievement! Send your parents a heartfelt 50th anniversary message to let them know how much you admire their loyalty and dedication to each other. “Congratulations on this major milestone, Mom and Dad! 50 years is an incredible feat, and I’m so inspired by your love and devotion to each other. Happy anniversary!” “Mom and Dad, happy 50th wedding anniversary! Over the past 5 decades, you’ve shown everyone who knows you the true meaning of commitment. You’re an inspiration to us all.” “Happy 50th anniversary, Mom and Dad! Spending half a century with someone is a huge accomplishment, and the two of you make it seem like a breeze. I love you both so much!” “To the best parents I could ever ask for, congratulations on 50 years of marriage! Your relationship has shown me that true love is real, and that it can last forever.” “Happy anniversary, Mom and Dad! You’ve spent half a century together, but you still manage to act like newlyweds. Your love story is definitely one for the ages!”

steps.title: Send a silly anniversary message to bring a smile to your parents’ faces.
steps.content: Send a silly anniversary message to bring a smile to your parents’ faces. If your parents are jokesters, they’ll appreciate the humor and laughs on their special day. “Happy anniversary to my favorite couple. Without the two of you, I wouldn’t be where I am today—Literally!” “You may have been married longer than I’ve been alive, but I swear, the two of you don’t look a day over 30. Happy anniversary, Mom and Dad!” “Happy anniversary to my wonderful parents! May you continue to love each other more than you annoy each other for many years to come.” “The secret to a good marriage is to be a little deaf.” – Ruth Bader Ginsburg “Marriage is not just spiritual communion. It is also remembering to take out the trash.” – Dr. Joyce Brothers “A wedding anniversary is the celebration of love, trust, partnership, tolerance and tenacity. The order varies for any given year.” – Paul Sweeney “She’s your lobster! C’mon you guys. It’s a known fact that lobsters fall in love and mate for life. You can actually see old lobster couples, walking around their tank, you know, holding claws.” — Friends

steps.title: Consider adding one of these quotes about love to your message.
steps.content: Consider adding one of these quotes about love to your message. These poignant, thoughtful, and romantic quotes can make your anniversary wishes even more meaningful. “Love recognizes no barriers. It jumps hurdles, leaps fences, penetrates walls to arrive at its destination full of hope.” – Maya Angelou “Love grows more tremendously full, swift, poignant, as the years multiply.” – Zane Grey “Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.” – Aristotle “The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.” – Audrey Hepburn “Everything that I understand, I understand only because I love.” – Leo Tolstoy “Love is not just looking at each other, it’s looking in the same direction.” Antoine de Saint-Exupéry “The best love is the kind that awakens the soul and makes us reach for more, that plants a fire in our hearts and brings peace to our minds.” – Nicholas Sparks “To love or have loved, that is enough. Ask nothing further. There is no other pearl to be found in the dark folds of life.” – Leo Tolstoy “Love doesn’t just sit there, like a stone, it has to be made, like bread; remade all the time, made new.” – Ursula K. LeGuin “A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person.” – Mignon McLaughlin

steps.title: If your parents are religious, send them an anniversary blessing.
steps.content: If your parents are religious, send them an anniversary blessing. Your parents’ anniversary is the perfect time to thank them for setting such a great example with their faith, and to pray for continued blessings in their marriage for the years to come. Here are some examples: “Happy anniversary, Mom and Dad! Your marriage is a testament to God’s love and grace, and I’m so lucky to witness it.” “To my incredible parents, thank you for being such incredible role models in your faith, and for embodying God’s love in everything you do. Happy anniversary!” “Today, I thank God that the two of you said ‘I do’ all those years ago and built this beautiful life for our family. Happy anniversary, Mom and Dad!” “May God continue to shower blessings on your marriage in the years to come. Happy anniversary to the most wonderful parents I could have ever asked for.” “Mom and Dad, God’s love and faithfulness shines through the both of you, and I thank Him every day for blessing me with such amazing parents. Happy anniversary!” “Happy anniversary to my parents! Wishing you a day filled with God’s presence and love.” “As you celebrate another year together, I pray for God’s continued blessings upon your marriage. Happy anniversary, Mom and Dad!” “Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs.” 1 Corinthians 13:4-5 “And now these three remain: faith, hope, and love. But the greatest of these is love.” 1 Corinthians 13:13 “Two are better than one, because they have a good return for their labor. If either of them falls down, one can help the other up.” Ecclesiastes 4:9-10 “So they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.” Matthew 19:6

steps.title: Honor your parents’ memory with a heartfelt anniversary message.
steps.content: Honor your parents’ memory with a heartfelt anniversary message. If your parents have passed away, you may be missing them a little extra when their anniversary comes around. You might find it helpful to write a thoughtful anniversary message to them or post a loving tribute to them on social media. Here are some examples of what you could say: “Happy anniversary to my incredible parents. I wish you were here, but I know you’re celebrating together in heaven.” “Mom and Dad, your love is a gift I’ll always carry in my heart. Happy heavenly anniversary to the best parents I could ever ask for.” “Today, we honor your love and faithfulness to each other, and remember all the beautiful memories we shared as a family. Happy heavenly anniversary, Mom and Dad! ” “Mom and Dad, your love left a lasting impact on everyone who knew you, and we miss you every day. Happy anniversary in heaven!” “Wishing a very happy anniversary to my parents in heaven. Even though you’re gone, I still feel your love guiding me in everything I do.” “Happy heavenly anniversary, Mom and Dad! Today, I celebrate your love and the lasting legacy it left on everyone who knew you.” “Mom and Dad, today we celebrate your beautiful love story and cherish the memories you left behind. Happy heavenly anniversary!” “Happy anniversary to my wonderful parents. We all miss you so much, but we know you’re watching over us from heaven.”

steps.title: A thoughtful act or gift can make your parents' day even more special.
steps.content: A thoughtful act or gift can make your parents' day even more special. From making them a sentimental DIY gift to throwing an anniversary party, there are tons of things you can do to celebrate your parents’ love and commitment. Here are some ideas to inspire you: Make a photo album or scrapbook filled with sweet family memories from all their years of marriage. Order a beautiful floral arrangement to be delivered to their home, or make your own bouquet and deliver it to them yourself. Throw a dinner party in your parents’ honor and invite close friends and family members to celebrate their love. Treat your parents to a fun experience as an anniversary gift. Get them tickets to see their favorite artist, book them a couples massage, or even plan a weekend getaway for the two of them at a nice hotel. Get a special gift that corresponds to the amount of years your parents have been married. Here’s a list of years and their corresponding gifts: 15th anniversary: Crystal 20th anniversary: China 25th anniversary: Silver 30th anniversary: Pearls 40th anniversary: Ruby 50th anniversary: Gold 60th anniversary: Diamond [3] X Research source
